text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HET FINANCIEELE DAGBLAD
- Cabinet against setting limits on growth of air traffic at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport. (p1)
- Printer and copier maker Oce van der Grinten forecasts profit growth of at least 20 percent. (p1)
- Dutch central bank DNB fails to gain supervisory authority over municipal money-lending institutions. (p1)
- Spanish premier Jose Maria Aznar supports Dutch central banker Wim Duisenberg's candidacy for the European central bank. (p1)
- Dutch telephone rates to the U.S. could fall by 80 pct, says Paul Gelderloos of Telegroup Nederland. (p1)
- Economic affairs minister Hans Wijers is prepared to speed up electricity market deregulation. (p3)
- Aluminium smelter Alucart International to join forces with Italy's aluminium components supplier Stampal. (p3)
- Dutch Rail NS sells part of its rail-building activities to builders NBM Amstelland and Volker Stevin. (p4)
DE VOLKSKRANT
- Agriculture ministry gains EU grant to subsidize slaughter of 800,000 from swine fever contaminated areas. (p1)
- Amsterdam Stock Exchange index shows record rise of 12.5 points to 731.99 on Monday. (p1)
- Chemicals concern DSM launches suit against Japanese rival Mitsui for breach of patent. (p2)
- Retailers are tired of waiting for the Postbank's smart cash payments card, the Chipper. (p2)
DE TELEGRAAF
- A Boeing carrying 173 Tamil asylum seekers which landed ot Schiphol Airport was chartered by the passengers themselves in a concerted action to gain asylum. (p1)
- Board chairman Roland Oliemans of transport group Frans Maas resigns on March 1, for personal reasons. (p1)
- Economic affairs ministry cautiously optimistic about chances of a restart of bankrupt aircraft maker Fokker. (p21)
- FNV trades union federation seeks to extend ban on temporary workers in the building trade. (p21)
TROUW
- Dutch industry to profit from NATO order for production of NH-90 helicopter. (p3)
- Employment at Schiphol Airport increased 6.2 percent in the year to end-October 1996. (p7)
ALGEMEEN DAGBLAD
- European Commission gives green light to paper and packaging group KNP BT takeover of two paper distributors. (p11)
